pageContext.claim: “It wasn't even a long-term deal. It was -- you know, right now, the time is almost up. This was like a short-term deal. It was like you rent a store in a shopping center. This -- these are countries we're dealing with. You need length. But it was a short-term deal.”
pageContext.analysis: The Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, as the Iran nuclear deal is formally known, actually bars Iran from ever seeking, developing or acquiring nuclear weapons; that element of the deal does not expire. Trump is alluding to the argument that some restrictions in the deal sunset over time and that Iran could pursue a nuclear weapons program in secret once those restrictions are gone.
